sources.title: The living and the dead, Part One | WAR DRAMA
sources.description:
Part Two: https://youtu.be/SeUKETNYHUM

Based on the novel by K. Simonov. Journalist Ivan Sintsov receives news of the treacherous attack of Nazi Germany while on vacation. Now he is a war correspondent... Sintsov witnesses the difficult retreats of the first months of the war.

IMDb rating: 7.6

Year of production: 1963

Director: Stolper Alexander
Screenwriter: Stolper Alexander
Operator: Olonovsky Nikolay
Production designer: Volkov Stalen

Cast: Pushkarev Igor, Efremov Oleg, Krylova Lyudmila, Glazyrin Alexey, Papanov Anatoly, Pavlova Sofya, Shutov Evgeniy, Avdyushko Victor, Gluzsky Mikhail, Dubrovin Yuri, Chirkov Boris, Lavrov Kirill, Vorobyov Mikhail, Krugly Lev, Ulyanov Mikhail, Muravyov Vladimir , Samoilov Evgeniy, Gorelov Vladimir, Telegina Valentina, Kurkina Raisa, Makarov Vasily, Volkov Yuri, Aleynikova Arina, Paulus Vladlen, Khomyatov Roman, Lyubimova Lyudmila, Lyubetsky Lev, Kulik Valentin, Bityukov Boris, Shibankov Vladimir, Marenkov Vladimir, Ardov Boris, Vysokovsky Zinovy, Sergeev Nikolay, Yurchenko Boris, Yakushev O.

metadata.Plot: A descent into Hell is triggered when "Ex-Lord" Donald Brocklebank finds that he must leave Longleigh House for London to find a way to pay for the medical treatments for his wife Nancy. Alone, his over-protected, delusional, adult son, James, fancies himself in charge of the manor house with his terminally ill mother, and barricades the two of them into the house for a series of ever more panicked home treatments, mistakenly protecting her from the arrival of Nurse Mary and any outside help.
metadata.Actors: Leo Bill, Roger Lloyd Pack, Kate Fahy
